autoComplete.description:
This prop helps users to fill forms faster, especially on mobile devices.
The name can be confusing, as it's more like an autofill.
You can learn more about it [following the specification](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#autofill).

autoFocus.description: If `true`, the `input` element will be focused during the first mount.

classes.description:
Override or extend the styles applied to the component.
See [CSS API](#css) below for more details.

className.description: The CSS class name of the wrapper element.

color.description: The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component.

defaultValue.description: The default `input` element value. Use when the component is not controlled.

disabled.description: If `true`, the `input` element will be disabled.

error.description:
If `true`, the input will indicate an error. This is normally obtained via context from
FormControl.

fullWidth.description: If `true`, the input will take up the full width of its container.

inputComponent.description:
The component used for the native input.
Either a string to use a DOM element or a component.

inputRef.description: Pass a ref to the `input` element.

label.description:
The label of the input. It is only used for layout. The actual labelling
is handled by `InputLabel`. If specified `labelWidth` is ignored.

labelWidth.description:
The width of the label. Is ignored if `label` is provided. Prefer `label`
if the input label appears with a strike through.

margin.description:
If `dense`, will adjust vertical spacing. This is normally obtained via context from
FormControl.

multiline.description: If `true`, a textarea element will be rendered.

notched.description: If `true`, the outline is notched to accommodate the label.

onChange.description: Callback fired when the value is changed.

tags.title: param
tags.description:
The event source of the callback.
You can pull out the new value by accessing `event.target.value` (string).
tags.name: event

placeholder.description: The short hint displayed in the input before the user enters a value.

readOnly.description:
It prevents the user from changing the value of the field
(not from interacting with the field).

required.description: If `true`, the `input` element will be required.

rows.description: Number of rows to display when multiline option is set to true.

rowsMax.description: Maximum number of rows to display when multiline option is set to true.

type.description: Type of the `input` element. It should be [a valid HTML5 input type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#Form_%3Cinput%3E_types).

value.description: The value of the `input` element, required for a controlled component.

descriptions.root: Styles applied to the root element.
descriptions.colorSecondary: Styles applied to the root element if the color is secondary.
descriptions.focused: Styles applied to the root element if the component is focused.
descriptions.disabled: Styles applied to the root element if `disabled={true}`.
descriptions.adornedStart: Styles applied to the root element if `startAdornment` is provided.
descriptions.adornedEnd: Styles applied to the root element if `endAdornment` is provided.
descriptions.error: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `error={true}`.
descriptions.marginDense: Styles applied to the `input` element if `margin="dense"`.
descriptions.multiline: Styles applied to the root element if `multiline={true}`.
descriptions.inputMarginDense: Styles applied to the `input` element if `margin="dense"`.
descriptions.inputMultiline: Styles applied to the `input` element if `multiline={true}`.
descriptions.inputAdornedStart: Styles applied to the `input` element if `startAdornment` is provided.
descriptions.inputAdornedEnd: Styles applied to the `input` element if `endAdornment` is provided.
